result.execSummary:
The defendant Leticia Monet Christmas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Pay a fine of $50.00 plus all mandatory fees, costs, surcharges and DNA surcharge by 08-13-17 or serve 20 consecutive days in HOC.

COURT WILL CONSIDER MOTION FOR EXUNGEMENT IF DEFENDANT PAYS ALL MUNICIPAL FINES AND THIS FINE AND COSTS/AFTER SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETING THE SENTENCE.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence; No Huber privileges. Court objects to ES. Sentence to commence FORTHWITH

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leticia Monet Christmas in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT ONE: 

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

ON MOTION THE STATE, COURT ORDERED COUNT TWO:  DISMISSED AND READ IN AS TO SENTENCING. 

AS TO COUNT ONE: 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 74 DAYS  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 1 day time served.  NO  Huber privileges. Court objects to ES. Sentence to commence forthwith. 

Fine of $50.00  PLUS  all mandatory  fees,  costs, surcharges and dna surcharges to be paid by 8-13-2017 or serve 20 CONSECUTIVE days in the House of Correction. Defendant to provide DNA sample.

Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays all municipal  fines  and this fine and  costs/ and after  successfully completeing the sentence. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Leticia Monet Christmas in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-13-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leticia Monet Christmas in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea date scheduled for 08-04-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference scheduled for 07-15-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leticia Monet Christmas in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel informs Court she has received discovery and requests brief adjournment; defendant is on federal probation.
Court orders case adjourned for status in Branch 47.
Clerk:  jms
Pre-trial conference on June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Remaining bail to be returned to the remitter.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Bayshore Mall, Forever 21, Name of the Game, Champs.

Defendant Leticia Monet Christmas in court.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  OCCR Tape#15-109
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
